'''''Psilocybe aucklandii''''' is a [[psychedelic mushroom]], which has [[psilocybin]] and [[psilocin]] as main active compounds. It is in the section ''Zapotecorum'' of the genus ''[[Psilocybe]]''.<ref name="Guzman2012">{{cite journal |last=Guzmán |first=Gastón |authorlink=Gastón Guzmán  |title= New Taxonomical and Ethnomycological Observations on Psilocybe S.S. From Mexico, Africa and Spain |journal=Acta Botanica Mexicana |year=2012 |volume=100 |pages=79–106 |url=http://dialnet.unirioja.es/descarga/articulo/3988750.pdf}}</ref><ref name="Ramirez-Cruz2013">{{cite journal |last1=Ramírez-Cruz |first1=Virginia |last2=Guzmán |first2=Gastón
|last3= Villalobos-Arámbula |first3=Alma Rosa |last4=Rodríguez |first4=Aarón |last5=Matheny |first5=Brandon |last6= Sánchez-García |first6=Marisol |last7=Guzmán-Dávalos |first7=Laura |title=Phylogenetic inference and trait evolution of the psychedelic mushroom genus ''Psilocybe'' sensu lato (Agaricales)|journal=Botany |year=2013 |volume=91 |issue=9 |pages=573–591 |url=http://www.nrcresearchpress.com/doi/abs/10.1139/cjb-2013-0070#.VH_zGTHF9Vs |doi=10.1139/cjb-2013-0070}}</ref>

== Description ==
''Psilocybe aucklandii'' has a [[farinaceous]] smell and taste. The [[Pileus (mycology)|cap]] is 2–5 cm, conical to plane, chestnut brown, [[hygrophanous]], and bruises blue/green where damaged. It often has a broad [[umbo (mycology)|umbo]]. The [[Lamella (mycology)|gills]] are cream-colored when young and violet yellowish brown in age, with an [[wikt:adnate|adnate]] attachment. ''Psilocybe aucklandii'' spores are dark violet brown, oblong to ellipsoid, and 7 x 4 [[µm]]. The [[Stipe (mycology)|stipe]] is 4–9 cm long and .2–.5 cm thick. It is brown and bruises blueish. The stipe is [[wikt:pruinose|pruinose]], with [[fibril]]s near the base.<ref>Paul Stamets. Psilocybin Mushrooms of the World. pp 89-90. 1996, Ten Speed Press. {{ISBN|978-0-89815-839-7}}</ref>

==Distribution and habitat==
''Psilocybe aucklandii'' grows in clay based pine forest, directly from clay.  Its type collection was in the [[Waitakere Ranges]] near [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]], though it is more commonly found in the exotic pine plantation of [[Riverhead, New Zealand|Riverhead forest]].<ref>{{cite journal | doi = 10.1016/S0953-7562(09)80856-3 | last1 = Guzman | first1 = G | last2 = Bandala | first2 = VM | last3 = King | first3 = C. |name-list-format=vanc| year = 1991 | title = A new species of ''Psilocybe'' of section zapotecorum from New Zealand | url = | journal = Mycological Research | volume = 95 | issue = 4| pages = 507–508 }}</ref><ref>Johnston P, Buchanan PK. The genus Psilocybe (Agaricales) in New Zealand. ''New Zealand Journal of Botany'' 1995;33(3):379-388. {{Cite journal|doi=10.1080/0028825X.1995.10412964|title=The genus ''Psilocybe''(Agaricales) in New Zealand|journal=New Zealand Journal of Botany|volume=33|issue=3|pages=379–388|year=1995|last1=Johnston|first1=Peter(iR.}|last2=Buchanan|first2=Peter K.}}</ref>
